name: Clarion Hotel Portland Airport

reviews.text: Typical budget hotel, helpful staff. Room was clean but needed some repairs. Appreciated having microwave and fridge. Close-to-airport location did not leave a lot of options for nearby dining or entertainment. Enjoyed "The Voice" though, a Frank Sinatra-style singer who was there on Tuesday evening. Free breakfast was okay; really wish these hotels would offer more healthy choices, particularly when alternatives are not in the area.
reviews.title: Bargain Beauty

reviews.text: The Clarion not only offers a very nice room and breakfast, their customer service is like non other I've ever experienced. Their rooms are exceptionally clean. I stayed at this hotel with a group tour, however, I also spent some time there on my own. There is a metro that starts at the airport and goes into downtown Portland. When the hotel's shuttle was on the way to the airport for a pickup or drop off and they had room, they would let us ride along so we could catch the metro. This is just one example of their outstanding customer service. The front desk, cleaning staff and food preparers were all gracious and accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location and customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never made it past the high and mighty minimum wage front desk employee due to the fact I was using a prepaid card. Just because I use a prepaid card does NOT mean that I am a poor guest...or even poor in general. Perhaps I use this sort of card to be discreet and not have a charge on my regular statement. Afterall, isn't that exactly what this type of card is perfect for (hypothetically of course, but alas apparently not in the real world) and should it not be honored ANYWHERE visa is accepted, just like the ad says. There was over a thousand dollars available but the clerk was simply refusing to run it. I can not tell you how embarrassing this was in front of my guest and even other hotel guest waiting to check in were treated to a unnecessary display of attempted righteous indignation by the clerk. Shouldn't they indicate this on their information with orbitz or expedia and allow their client to pass in lieu of another place of genuine hospitality? I would most certainly take my business elsewhere versus enduring the humility I experienced that night!
reviews.title: Hospitality / People Skills < Zero

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a few times the night before or after a flight. Comfortable beds, small sofa, desk chair, room wi-fi, pool and some exercise machines. Breakfast is typical: instant oatmeal & fresh fruit are healthier options if overcooked eggs, sausage, tater-tots don't appeal. It's a quiet location convenient to 82nd for good Vietnamese restaurants Pho Van or Pho Oregon. Friendly hotel staff and shuttle drivers; well-lit parking lot in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good park'-and-fly choice

reviews.text: After researching quite a few hotels and disappointing mix of reviews, we chose the Clarion Hotel-Airport because it had the Platinum Award rating, and also had someone stop by to check out the hotel. We were not disappointed in our week's stay. The rooms were clean, comfortable and amazingly quiet for being so close to the airport. Beds were extremely comfortable, little decorative touches with the towels that showed care about the room and comfort, and the staff was helpful and friendly. They have a small early kind of breakfast for early travelers and a later typical buffet breakfast with a lot of choices. The rooms have a nice view over the small lake. We will definitely stay there again sometime when we are in Portland.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is very close to the airport, restaurants, and local attractions. Our room was on the 4th floor. The room was clean and spacious, and the bed had a Tempur-pedic mattress which was very comfortable. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi and movies for guests, and the staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. The only negative was the bathroom. The tub made a "crackling" noise when we took a shower or bath, there was some mildew or mold on the caulking around the tub, a loose handle on the tub/shower faucet, the bathroom vent worked only occasionally, and the cover to the vent did not fit properly. These issues were not serious enough to keep us from staying at this hotel again in the future. Overall we had a nice stay.
reviews.title: Great Location - Perfect Except for Bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 1 night during Memorial day weekend.
reviews.title: Everything was OK except bathtub.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First positive: an affordable price, friendly & helpful staffs, quick check in and out, comfortable bed, decent hot and cold breakfast choices. Breakfast is not great but not bad either. Breakfast room was real crowd due to holiday weekend and some guests didn’t have table for them. The location was a great for us as we spend day in downtown Portland and next day explore around Columbia gorge.
reviews.title: Great value! Spacious but thin walls

reviews.text: Negative: bathroom itself is fine. However, bathtub is another story. Chalking on bathtub had black molds and when we step in to middle of tub, squeaks REAL bad. Like squeaky floor. I was afraid to step into tub almost feel like tub will fall off from floor. Squeaky tub and mold on chalking was real turn off. I took picture of mold around tub from my phone and I show it to front desk when I check out. I also told front desk about squeaky tub problem.
reviews.title: Great location, clean room, great for an overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was told by a gentleman (maybe manager?) that they are in the process chalking and they are aware of problem. He asked me which floor I was staying and told him I was on 4th floor. He said they are finished chalking 1st and 2nd floors and working up. He also went to investigate squeaky bathtub since we were checking out. My room was 411. Overall, I will stay here again
reviews.title: The buffet breakfast is fantastic; staff friendly;super clean

reviews.text: I only stayed here one night (flying out of Portland), but I thought this was a really good, comfortable room. Desk and TV were convenient to work at. Staff was great. Shuttle to airport great. Rooms were comfortable. Seldom sleep on the memory foam mattress (if that is what it was), but slept for a 8 hours and feel good. Breakfast was hot and diverse. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Convenient, Breakfast, Room

reviews.text: Don't be misled by the title - overall, my family's stay at the Clarion was very pleasant. The beds were extremely comfortable, with two different pillow selections and a good, soft mattress. The TV had a large variety of channels with movies on demand. The staff was friendly, and breakfast was included from 6 - 9. Unfortunately, the breakfast was so dissapointing that I had to go out and buy an early lunch. The waffles were repulsive, and the only syrup available (not that a good syrup could've saved the waffle) was mrs butterworth. The orange juice was watered down, and when I opened the large, silver hot box that contained the eggs, I truly did a double take because i couldn't tell if i was looking at eggs or pineapples. Dried up and miscolored, the eggs were uneatable. Overall, this hotel is a great place to spend a night or two, especially if you're coming from the portland airport (5 minute drive). Just don't eat the pineapples. I mean eggs.
reviews.title: Eggs look like pineapples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our usual airport hotel for our out of town trips. We booked the park and fly rate for the beginning of our trip and another room for our return a week later. On the first night, we had an A/C that was quite noisy. We switched from fan to cool and it was a bit better, but in the middle of the night it started clanking and then died altogether. We reported it in the morning on checkout and they apologized and gave me an extra 1000 points on our Choice Privileges account. When we returned we got the best room we've ever had there, on the 4th floor with a very quiet A/C and got a wonderful full night's sleep.
reviews.title: A mostly positive review

reviews.text: This is by no means an upscale hotel, but we've always found it ideal for our needs. The rooms have nice views over a lake and the breakfast is the normal fare for such hotels, which is good enough.
reviews.title: surprise wake-up call

reviews.text: What i did notice was that the hotel was in the process of upgrading a lot of the room amenities. New bathroom sink and tub/shower faucets, for example. I'm confident they'll soon replace (if they haven't already) the clunky A/C in that first room.
reviews.title: The best for a business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel tries hard to fight above its weight. The rating we give is relative to others in its class.
reviews.title: Reality check this is a 2 1/2 star hotel working hard to do more than 'it says on the tin'

reviews.text: The rooms are large with a comfortable sitting area including the sofa and coffeetable.
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.text: The beds are very comfortable and the linens reasonable except that as in so many cases not quite big enough for the very deep mattresses .
reviews.title: On The Way To Bend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no disturbance from aircraft noise.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is slightly above average for included/complimentary breakfasts in hotels of this rating and include a good supply of fresh fruit and hard-boiled eggs. The food was frequently replenished. The seating area for eating breakfast was often crowded.
reviews.title: great location for airport

description: Clarion Hotel Portland International Airport is a 101 room property where you will feel right at home. All of our rooms have lake views, we offer Tempur-pedic mattresses (ask for our Deluxe Rooms), a hot free breakfast and of course an airport shuttle. Perfect for a business traveler or a family getaway!
